sentence.text: ï»¿Patient 1 (V-1) is the first male child of related parents from Mayotte (Comoro) Island (Fig. 1A).

He was first seen at 7 months of age, with severe craniosynostosis with a trilobular cloverleaf-shaped skull, marked scaphocephaly, dilatation of the ventricules, and a large head circumference (45 cm > 2.5 SD; Fig. 2A).
He had hypoplasia of middle phalanges, large thumbs, bilateral preaxial polydactyly of both feet, cutaneous syndactyly of fingers and toes, (Fig. 2A) and bowing of the femora.
Body weight and height were below average.
He underwent a cranioplasty and ventriculoperitoneal shunt and was then lost to follow-up.
